properties.areaDesc: Southeast Big Horn Basin; North Big Horn Basin
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 1 at 4:12AM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
A strong winter storm and associated strong cold front will bring
significant snowfall to the area as well as sharply colder
temperatures.

* WHAT and WHERE...3 to 5 inches in the Northern Big Horn Basin
and 4 to 7 inches in the Southeast Big Horn Basin.

* WHEN...Sunday evening through Monday afternoon.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Roads will become slick and snow covered.
Expect significant blowing and drifting snow in exposed areas.
High temperatures will drop by around 25 degrees Monday compared
to what the high temperatures will be Saturday. Stay tuned for
further statements and updates concerning this snow event.

NWSheadline: Significant snowfall expected late Sunday and into Monday
